page.title: 19TOWN COUNCIL MEETING.
page.content: At the August l985 meeting the Mayor reported that the County Council was sympathetic to the council's request for early attention to the poor condition of roads in Fairford. A bottle bank is to be situated near the Fire Station on an experimental basis to extend glass conservation in the district. Â£5O is to be spent on signs warning the public of the penalties for allowing dogs to foul footpaths and verges. With the probable loss of Fairford's allotments following the Fairford Property Review, the council is looking for alternative sites. The possible publication of a community magazine was met with the approval of the councillors who are anxious to get over a number of issues of public interest to the whole town.
